items.content_html: In this blog post, I share my thoughts and feelings as I celebrate my 21st birthday. Join me as I reflect on my journey so far, the expectations I had as a child, and the realization that I am now entering adulthood. I ponder what my younger self would think of the person I have become, and I express gratitude for the incredible people and experiences that have shaped my life. Come along as I navigate the excitement and nostalgia that come with turning 21.
items.title: Turning 21

items.content_html: Low-level programming is a style of computer programming in which little or no abstraction is used between the instructions in the programming language and the architecture's machine code instructions. Low-level programming is the opposite of high-level programming, which uses a large amount of abstraction to make the process of developing a program easier.
items.title: What I learnt from writing low level code for a semester
items.summary: Low-level programming is a style of computer programming in which little or no abstraction is used between the instructions in the programming language and the architecture's machine code instructions. Low-level programming is the opposite of high-level programming, which uses a large amount of abstraction to make the process of developing a program easier.

items.content_html:
However, Heroku is not the only PaaS  platform out there. In this article, we will look at some of the best Heroku alternatives as it has announced to stop supporting the free tier (hobby) plan from November 28th 2022.You can read more about this [here](https://blog.heroku.com/next-chapter/).
I still remember the first time I deployed an application on Heroku, It was so easy to deploy.
It was a simple Flask application that I had cloned from [hastebin](https://hastebin.com/), I still think its deployed somewhere on Heroku. [hastebin-clone](https://haste-bin-clone.herokuapp.com/)
It literally deployed any code I threw at it that too for free. I was amazed at how easy it was to deploy an application on Heroku.It was essiential to any developer starting out.
Earlier in the days it was not easy to run code on server, it required a special set of knowledge and skills to run code on a server.
items.title: Heroku Alternatives
items.summary:

I still remember the first time I deployed an application on Heroku, It was so easy to deploy.
It was a simple Flask application that I had cloned from [hastebin](https://hastebin.com/), I still think its deployed somewhere on Heroku. [hastebin-clone](https://haste-bin-clone.herokuapp.com/)
It literally deployed any code I threw at it that too for free. I was amazed at how easy it was to deploy an application on Heroku.It was essiential to any developer starting out.
Earlier in the days it was not easy to run code on server, it required a special set of knowledge and skills to run code on a server.

items.content_html: JavaScript is the one of the easiest langauge to learn and as well as the most confusing langauge ever. I have been using JavaScript for more than 2 years and I have missed out of a fair share of features. One of the most common mistakes I have seen is people (including me) using map() and forEach() wrong. Now JavaScript offers us two methods to iterate over an array, `map()` and `forEach()`.
items.title: Don't get confused between map() and forEach()

items.content_html: If you have experience with JS you know that the data type is completely dynamic, to give you a example, I declare arr` as a const , and try to apply arr.map()` function, This is a error because arr` is not a array to map through and we’ll get to know this error during run (JS doesn’t need any compiling we can directly run / interpret it in Browser) time which is more frustrating for a developer

items.content_html: It encourages you to invest in real estate, and there if you make a loss it teaches how to be not sad about losing the money instead of taking it as a lesson for future investments. It gives you simple explanations of how money works. It will not give you any trading tips, but it helps you understand the things no one teaches us in the school or at home. The financial insights aid you to take action, and be your boss.
